trace.header.title: Trace
trace.overview.title: Welcome to Trace!
trace.overview.description.first: Follow an HTTP request through Cloudflare's <0>reverse proxy</0> to understand when and how your active configurations are executed.
trace.overview.description.second: Simulate an HTTP request for a <0>proxied</0> hostname to understand the impact of your Cloudflare configurations.
trace.overview.description.third: Understand how different Cloudflare configurations interact with an HTTP request for one of your <0>proxied</0> hostnames.
trace.overview.card.title: How to use Cloudflare Trace
trace.overview.card.description: Follow an HTTP/S request through Cloudflare's reverse proxy to your origin. Results will show matches for all active rules and configurations, both at the account level or for a specific domain or subdomain. If the hostname is not <0>proxied by Cloudflare</0>, Trace will still return all the configurations that Cloudflare would have applied to the request.
trace.overview.card.configuration.descri: Select a hostname that belongs to your Cloudflare account and tune its configurations.
trace.overview.card.trace.description: Enter a URL and select options to simulate the conditions of a real HTTP/S request.
trace.overview.card.assess.description: Review the matches to assess if your configurations are evaluated and executed as intended, and re-tune as needed.
trace.search.title: Trace builder
trace.search.description: Define properties and simulate different conditions for an HTTP/S request to trace through Cloudflare. Inactive rules will not be evaluated.
trace.search.url.label: Enter a URL that belongs to your account you wish to run a trace against.
trace.search.method.label: Select the HTTP method (for example, GET, POST, PUT) for the request you want to trace.
trace.search.protocol.description: Select the HTTP protocol version (for example, HTTP/1.0, HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2.0, HTTP/3.0) for the request you want to trace.
trace.search.protocol.label: Select a protocol
trace.search.headers.description: Customize User Agent and HTTP request headers for your trace.
trace.search.cookies.description: Enter any specific request cookies associated with the URL you are tracing.
trace.search.geo.description: Specify the geographical location details for your trace, including country, region and city.
trace.search.geo.city.label: City
trace.search.geo.country.label: Country
trace.search.geo.is_eu_country.label: Is this an european country?
trace.search.geo.iso_code.label: ISO Code
trace.search.geo.latitude.label: Enter a Latitude
trace.search.geo.longitude.label: Enter a Longitude
trace.search.geo.postal_code.label: Enter a Postal Code
trace.search.geo.region_code.label: Region
trace.search.geo.timezone.label: Enter a Subdivision 2 ISO code
trace.search.bot_score.description: Set the bot score for your trace. A lower score suggests automated traffic.
trace.search.bot_score.label: Enter a score between 1-99
trace.search.threat_score.description: Set the threat score for your trace. A higher score indicates a higher level of threat.
trace.search.threat_score.label: Enter a score between 1-99
trace.search.body.description: Enter the content of the request body if applicable. This can include data or information you want to include with the request.
trace.search.body.label: Select a body definition
trace.search.skip_challenge.label: Select a value for the skip challenge field
trace.search.skip_challenge.description: When enabled, bypasses any security challenges posed by Cloudflare security products and allows the trace to continue.
trace.request_sample.title: Request JSON
trace.request_sample.description: As you build your trace the details of your request will appear below
trace.search.plain_text.label: Request body as plain text
trace.search.json.label: Arbitrary json as request body
trace.results.title: Trace Results
trace.results.description:
These are all of the active rules/configurations in %{accountName} that would match HTTP/S requests like this trace, in the order they are evaluated and executed.

If needed, tune your account-level configurations from the side menu, or go to domain/subdomain-specific configurations.
trace.feedback: Help us improve Cloudflare Trace by <0>giving feedback</0>.
trace.results.filter.input: Search by product, rule name, or rule ID
trace.results.request: Copy this JSON to run the same trace later by pasting it here.
trace.results.error: There was an error and your trace could not be performed. Please try another URL or amend your configurations:
